snippet: The rise indicates that the authorities “heightened the suppression of human rights activism and dissent in Xinjiang,” said an advocacy group based in the United States.
abstract: Human rights group Dui Hua Foundation says data showing criminal trials in Xinjiang region of China increased 40 percent in 2014 over 2013 reflects mounting suppression of human rights activism and dissent, particularly among Uighur minority.
lead_paragraph: The rise indicates that the authorities “heightened the suppression of human rights activism and dissent in Xinjiang,” said an advocacy group based in the United States.
